1.heading: Louie.
1.title: "Cousin Louie"
1.author: [No author]
1.series: Herman and Katnip) 1 p. text in Harvey Hits, no. 18

2.heading: Louie.
2.title: Grandpa's Too-Good Garden
2.author: by James Stevenson.
notes: Several pages in comics format.
Summary (from OCLC): Grandpa tells Mary Ann and Louie about a garden he had years ago that his brother Wainey "helped" him plant.

3.heading: Louie.
3.title: "Hermie & Louie : They're Cool" 1 p. in Mom's Homemade Comics, no. 1
3.author: [No author]
notes: By Denis Kitchen.

4.heading: Louie.
4.title: "And a Full Cheeseburger the Next Time We Grill"
4.author: by Chip Dunham.
notes: Summary: Captain Crow makes promises to get Louie out of his chair.

5.heading: Louie.
5.title: "Boy, Louie Eats that Same Dried Junk Over and Over Every Day"
5.author: by Chip Dunham.
notes: Summary: Louie imagines his dog food is medallions of pork, asparagus, potatoes au gratin and salad with raspberry vinaigrette.

6.heading: Louie.
6.title: "I Didn't Think I'd Ever Get This Chew Toy Out From Under There"
6.author: by Chip Dunham.
notes: Summary: Rival pirates steal the safe in the night, and they wonder why Louie doesn't bark at them.

7.heading: Louie.
7.title: "I Was Saying a Whole Lot of Stuff There and the Only Thing You Understood was 'Jump'"
7.author: by Chip Dunham.
notes: Summary: Louie isn't too helpful when the Captain gets stuck in the hold.

8.heading: Louie.
8.title: "I Was Wondering Why I Wasn't Salivating"
8.author: by Chip Dunham.
notes: Summary: Louie sniffs the outdoor grill, and is told it's tofu burgers.

9.heading: Louie.
9.title: "It's Tough to be The Mysterious Stranger When You're Stopping to Use a Pooper-Scooper"
9.author: by Chip Dunham.
notes: Summary: Charley takes Louie for a walk.

10.heading: Louie.
10.title: "My Cat's Going to Smell It, and He's Going to be Extremely Upset"
10.author: by Chip Dunham.
notes: Summary: She has petted Louie, and regrets it, but Louie looks pleased.

11.heading: Louie.
11.title: "Remind Me to Have a Little Talk With You Guys Later About the Order of This Rescue, Okay?"
11.author: by Chip Dunham.
notes: Summary: The cabin is on fire, and the crew brings out Louie (the dog), the television set, the dog food, and then the captain.

12.heading: Louie.
12.title: "Sometimes I Get Yelled at for Doing That on Deck"
12.author: by Chip Dunham.
notes: Summary: Louie's mess on deck caused an enemy to slip and saved Captain Crow's life, and Louie gets a medal and a little confusion.

13.heading: Louie.
13.title: "The Whole Week is Cat Joke, Cat Joke, Cat Joke"
13.author: by Chip Dunham.
notes: Summary: Louie (the dog) has taken over scripting the strip.

14.heading: Louie.
14.title: "You Better Hope He Doesn't Come Back Here with Two Cookies"
14.author: by Chip Dunham.
notes: Summary: Louie respects the Captain's sad mood and isn't lured away by a cookie.

15.heading: Louie.
15.title: "You Can't Jump In There, Louie, There's Sharks in There!"
15.author: by Chip Dunham.
notes: Summary: The captain prevents his dog from going for a swim, but has no problem with Charley diving in.

16.title: Louie
16.author: Hanan.
notes: Summary: Louie's fish are small, but he buys a big fish from a boy, but then a game warden sees him by the hatchery sign.
Strip without words.

17.title: Louie
17.author: Hanan.
notes: Summary: A little boy cries to get Louie to let him push the lawnmower, and a woman swats Louie with her umbrella for making the boy mow the lawn.
Wordless strip.

18.title: Louie
18.author: Hanan.
notes: Summary: Dr. Zigsby is just leaving for golf when Louie arrives, and after a quick listen with the stethoscope takes Louie golfing.

19.title: Louie
19.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Louie waters the flowers where the dog is sleeping, and the dog comes over and shakes himself on Louie.
Strip without words.

20.title: Louie
20.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Louie's dog has chased a man up a tree; Louie intercedes and gets chased up the tree as well.
Strip without words.

21.title: Louie
21.author: Hanan.
notes: Summary: Louie daydreams about golf, and after the boss yells at him his daydream includes the boss as his caddy.
Wordless strip.

22.title: Louie
22.author: Hanan.
notes: Silent strip.
Summary: Louie faints when he sees the total for their bag of groceries.

23.title: Louie
23.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Louie goes to the store to buy milk, and returns with a bag of dog food because of an attractive saleswoman.

24.title: Louie
24.author: Hanan.
notes: Summary: Louie tries to give advice in the kitchen, and ends up cooking (and burning) the meal himself.
Silent strip.

25.title: Louie
25.author: Hanan.
25.series: Dec. 1, 1953) "There is No Gift as Friendly as a Book!"*
notes: Summary: Louie leaves the house with a vase bouncing off his head, and returns to a smoke-filled kitchen with a gift from the bookstore. He leaves the house again with a cookbook bouncing off his head.

162.title: "Une Lourde Main s'Abattit sur l'Épaule de la Princesse"
162.author: [No author]
162.series: Gaie Princesse) p. 10-13 in Le Journal de Nano et Nanette, no. 200
notes: "Résumé: Afin de pouvoir côtoyer les jeunes de son âge, la princesse Lola, nièce de Ricardo, régent du royaume de San Sereno, s'était déguisée. La gouvernante de celle-ci, la comtesse Francesca, ignorait que la jeune fille avait dû accepter de cirer les chaussures des passants afin d'être admise par les jeunes gens qu'elle désirait fréquenter."
Plates numbered 9-12.
"A suivre."
